segments.text: Why did he invite her here?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Why does that bother you?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: She's been in New York for three and half years.  Why all of a sudden?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, maybe he just wanted to see her again.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Nobody comes seven hundred miles just to see.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What do you mean?  He lived next door to the girl all his life.  Why wouldn't he want to see her again?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't look at me like that.  He didn't tell me anymore than he told you.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: She's not-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How do you know he's even thinking of it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: -he's not gonna marry her.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's got that all about it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, so what?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What's going on here, Joe?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Now, listen Kate.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: She's not his girl, Joe.  She knows she's not.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You can't read her mind.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well then why is she still single?  I mean, New York is full of men.  Why isn't she married?  Probably a hundred people told her she's crazy, but she's waited.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How do you know why she's waited?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: She knows what I know, that's why.  She's faithful as a rock.  In my worst moments I think of her waiting and I know again that I'm right.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Look, it's a nice day.  What are we arguing for?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Nobody in this house dares take her faith away, Joe?  Strangers might, but not his father, not his brother.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, what do you want me to do about it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I want you to act like he's coming back.  Both of you.  Don't you think I haven't noticed since she got here.  I won't stand for any nonsense.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: But Kate--
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Because if he's not coming back, I'll kill myself.  I mean, laugh--laugh at me, but...
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: But why did that happen the very night she came here?  She sleeps in his room and his memorial breaks to pieces.  Just look.  Look at it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Believe with me, Joe.  I can't stand all alone.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Last week, a man turned up in Detroit missing longer than Larry.  I mean, you read it yourself.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: All right.  All right.  Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You, above all, have to believe.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What?- Why- Why me above all?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Just--just don't stop believing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What does that mean?  Me above all?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Look at you.  Look at you shaking.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I can't help it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What have I got to hide?  What the hell is the matter with you Kate?
segments.speaker: M
